game.model.movement

Class LineMover

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.model.movement.LineMover
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MoveStrategy
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BishopMovement, QueenMovement, RookMovement

    public abstract class LineMover
extends java.lang.Object
implements MoveStrategy
    An abstract strategy class for the Chess pieces that move along lines.
    Author:
    Andreas Nylund, Hanna Granholm

      • getValidMovement

        public abstract java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.Point> getValidMovement(java.awt.Point point,
                                                   int[][] matrix,
                                                   int piece)
        Description copied from interface: MoveStrategy
        Method returning an arraylist of valid movements for the specified piece from the specified piece on the specified board.
        Specified by:
        getValidMovement in interface MoveStrategy
        Parameters:
        point - The starting tile.
        matrix - A color matrix representation of the board, 1 being enemy color and -1 being friendly.
        piece - The piece at the starting tile.
        Returns:
        A list of valid movements for the specified piece, board and tile.

      • getValidLine

        protected void getValidLine(java.awt.Point point,
                int dx,
                int dy)
        Returns a valid line of tiles that can be moved along this line.

        For example, the code getValidLine(tile, 1, 0); Will add all valid tiles to the right of the specified tile.

        Parameters:
        point - Starting tile.
        dx - Movement along x-axis per iteration.
        dy - Movement along y-axis per iteration.
